info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 18 at 5:49AM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...Patchy Dense Fog Will Continue Until 8 AM... Patches of dense fog have developed across the lower and mid Rio Grande Valley very early this morning. In typically fog-prone locations, visibility has fallen to between one-quarter and one- half mile, with a few spots briefly falling below one-quarter mile. Locations include sections of the Interstate 2 corridor between Weslaco and Harlingen, as well as rural farm areas from northern Hidalgo and Willacy through eastern Hidalgo and northern Cameron County. The fog will lift into stratus clouds by or just after 8 AM, following a wind shift from the north that will quickly cause it to dissipate. Motorists are urged to slow down, keep a safe distance between vehicles, and use low beam headlights or fog lights when driving early this morning.
